1.text: Wherefore were not times hidden from the Almighty? and they knowing him saw not his days.

2.text: They will remove the bound; they will strip off the flock, and they will feed.

3.text: They will lead away the ass of the orphans, and they will take for pledge, the widowâ€™s ox.

4.text: They will turn the needy from the Way: the poor of the earth hid themselves together.

5.text: Behold, wild asses in the desert will go forth in their work, seeking for prey: the sterile region bread for him, and for the young.

6.text: In the field they will harvest his meslin, and they will glean the vintage of the unjust one.

7.text: They will cause the naked to lodge without clothing, and no covering in the cold.

8.text: They will be wet from the pouring rains of the mountains, and they embraced the rock from no shelter.

9.text: They will strip the orphan from the breast, and take a pledge for the poor.

10.text: They caused the naked to go without clothing, and from the hungry they took away the sheaf;

11.text: Between their walls they will press out oil; they trod their wine-presses, and they will thirst.

12.text: From the city men will groan, and the soul of the wounded will cry out: and God will not set folly.

13.text: They were among the rebels of light; they knew not his ways, and they dwelt not in his beaten paths.

14.text: The murderer will rise by light; he will kill the poor and needy; and in the night he will be as a thief.

15.text: And the eye of the adulterer watched the twilight, saying, Eye shall not perceive me: and secretly he will set the face.

16.text: To break through houses in darkness in the day they shut up for themselves: they knew not light.

17.text: For the morning altogether to them the shadow of death: if it shall be known, the terrors of the shadow of death.

18.text: He is swift upon the face of the waters; their portion will be cursed in the earth: he will not see the way of the vineyards.

19.text: Dryness, also heat, will strip the snow waters: hades him sinning.

20.text: The womb shall forget him; the worm sucked him; he shall be no more remembered: and iniquity shall be broken as a tree.

21.text: He did evil to the barren; she will not bear: and he will not do good to the widow.

22.text: And he drew the mighty in his power: he will rise up and none shall be sure in living.

23.text: It will he given to him for confidence, and he will rest upon: and his eyes upon their ways.

24.text: They were lifted up a little while, and they are not, and they were brought low; as all they will be drawn together, and as the head of an ear of grain they shall be cut off.

25.text: And if not now, who will cause me to lie, and set my words for nought?
